Text.Value: *A crack like a breaking bone. Hope winces.*
BUT FIRST GO GET YOUR CONTRACT

EditorData.NodeContext: instruction, urgently delivered

Text.Value: *You hesitate a moment too long, and Hope begins to fidget and panic.*
Flames. Monsters. Agony.

EditorData.NodeContext: composing herself and lisitng out the things that might happen as if they're very specific and scientific, despite the vagueness of her warning

Text.Value: WE WILL RIP OUT THEIR GIZZARDS

EditorData.NodeContext: triumphant outburst

Text.Value: Trigger the alarm, and Raphael will come swooping home on wings of malice to rip out your soul.

EditorData.NodeContext: dramatic

Text.Value: Oh no. They hear me... Speak quickly, speak softly, you know how this goes.

EditorData.NodeContext: trying to compose herself, slowing down more than usual before the ellipsiss, and then speaking quickly ad quietly

Text.Value: Focus, breathe with intent, and the flames that scorch your mind will recede, for they are nothing.
SCARIER THINGS THAN YOU LITTLE MOUSE

EditorData.NodeContext: scornful outburst

Text.Value: EXPLOIT HIS PIDDLING WEAKNESSES AND MAKE HIM GROVEL

EditorData.NodeContext: outburst of gleeful advice

Text.Value: IT'S ON THE TIP OF MY TONGUE BUT THEY SLICED OFF THE TIP OF MY TONGUE

EditorData.NodeContext: horrified

Text.Value: The Archivist is the key, but he's as stubborn as a king and as serious as a heart attack.

EditorData.NodeContext: relaying important information as straightforwardly as she can

Text.Value: YOU SHOULDN'T HAVE SIGNED IT YOU MAGNIFICENT MORON

EditorData.NodeContext: outburst, exasperated with the player for signing a contract with Raphael

Text.Value: Concentrate on speaking softly and without emotion.
I don't need any advice - I already know the masterword to dispel the magic protecting the artefacts.
*You steady your mind, and prepare your questions.*
The Archivist is the key. EXPLOIT HIS FEARS AND LUSTS.

EditorData.NodeContext: calm and serious on first sentence, and then an outburst of excited emotion on the second

Text.Value: Who does the Archivist fear, Hope? I need a name.
YOU CAN'T THERE IS NO HOPE FOR HOPE

EditorData.NodeContext: sad outburst

Text.Value: I DON'T HEAR A THING, SIR JAILOR, EXCEPT FOR THE GENTLE CRACKING OF MY RIBS

EditorData.NodeContext: calling out apologetically to an off-screen presence, with panic, attempting to placate

Text.Value: Her true form is so gargantuan and mind-scarring to behold that she takes on many guises when she visits.

EditorData.NodeContext: in awe as she describes a terrible devil

Text.Value: Once you do, the House will bare its teeth, and you'll only have a few minutes to get me out of my prison before Raphael arrives.

EditorData.NodeContext: hurried instructions

Text.Value: She won't have a choice - I'm getting you out of here. Just tell me how.
Shhhh... I'm doing it again I'm doing it again.

EditorData.NodeContext: shushing hersel after an outburstf, and fussing at heself

Text.Value: AND THEN IT ALL COMES TUMBLING DOWN

EditorData.NodeContext: gleeful outburst, despite the horror of the situation

Text.Value: Unfortunately, it's the most prized item in the collection, so the 'no touching' rule is strictly enforced.

EditorData.NodeContext: thinks very little of the 'no touching' rule, treating it like a kid would treat a rule not to speak in class

Text.Value: The only thing that matters is the Hammer.

EditorData.NodeContext: serious

Text.Value: AND YOU'RE ABOUT AS GRATEFUL AS A FLOWER IN A FURNACE

EditorData.NodeContext: outburst of exasperated indignation aimed at uncooperative player

Text.Value: Sorry. Let's try this again. Apologies, apologies, apologies. You're not a hatstand at all.

EditorData.NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst

Text.Value: I AM BEING BOILED ALIVE AND FILLED WITH A THOUSAND PINS

EditorData.NodeContext: exasperated, the player is NOT taking her predicament seriously

Text.Value: I'm doing the best I can. Please don't abandon me.
Hello again, little mouse. The price for speaking is steep, but I must give warning.

EditorData.NodeContext: speaking in hushed tones, pleased to see the player

Text.Value: Sounds like we'll have more luck with the Archivist.
How should I deal with the Archivist?
PLAY YOUR PART WELL AND YOU CAN BE ONE OF THOSE BLASPHEMOUS GUISES

EditorData.NodeContext: outburst of encouragement

Text.Value: IN THIS HOUSE THIEVES ARE MELTED LIKE BUTTER AND SPREAD ONTO TOAST

EditorData.NodeContext: raising volume as she blurts out a warning, losing control of her emotions

Text.Value: AND YOU'RE MORE OF A HATSTAND THAN A HERO

EditorData.NodeContext: nonsensical outburst after being insulted

Text.Value: Verillius... Verillius Receptor. A High Inquisitor of Zariel. Officially entitled to audit Raphael's collection.

EditorData.NodeContext: in pain, delivering this information is costing her a lot. Slower than her normal speech patterns as she fights the pain.

Text.Value: Pull yourself together.
Focus your efforts on formulating concise questions.
I need you to stay calm, Hope, and guide me.
Why can't I just take what I came for?
She won't let me escape. Not never ever never ever.

EditorData.NodeContext: childish, quiet tantrum

Text.Value: Think two steps ahead, plotting out your queries in advance.
Is there anyone else I should be aware of in the Archive?
My dearest sister Korrilla is in there too, pretending to browse the collection, acting all nonchalant. She's up to something.

EditorData.NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst, then suspicious

Text.Value: BUT FIRST GO GET THE HAMMER

EditorData.NodeContext: instruction, urgently delivered

Text.Value: You're about as helpful as a blunt dagger.
But since you asked so politely, I'll calm myself.

EditorData.NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst

Text.Value: I can I shall I can I shall.

EditorData.NodeContext: determined, repeating as a mantra to give herself confidence

Text.Value: Your prize is just ahead, in the Archive, but you can't take it yet, and even if you could, you mustn't.

EditorData.NodeContext: excited to tell you you're close to your prize, but disappointed to break the news that you can't take it yet

Text.Value: He fears authority figures. Perhaps his teacher took a strap to him and left a deep impression at an early age.

EditorData.NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst on the previous line - trying to relay important information

Text.Value: PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE TAKE ME WITH YOU WHEN YOU LEAVE

EditorData.NodeContext: desperate, pleading

Text.Value: TRY IT AND YOU WILL BE NOTHING BUT BONES

EditorData.NodeContext: excitedly relaying terrible information

Text.Value: There's one regular visitor that he particularly fears... She is... shhhhhhh...

EditorData.NodeContext: decreasing volume as she realises somebody is listening in... hushing herself

Text.Value: You're more of a hindrance than a help.
My heart just skipped a beat - you might just pull this off.

EditorData.NodeContext: excited, almost flirtatious

Text.Value: Slight problem. The flames are scorching my backside as well as my mind. But I like your optimism, and I can help.

EditorData.NodeContext: awkwardly letting the player know tha tthey're advice didn't help all that much, but genuinely pleased that they're trying their best

Text.Value: Not without the Hammer. It can shatter all infernal chains, including those that hold me.

EditorData.NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst, telling us what we need to know to help her

Text.Value: Being here is a violation of so many subclauses and stipulations in your contract that Raphael will snuff out your soul the minute he catches sight of you.

EditorData.NodeContext: dramatic

Text.Value: I need to get you out of here, Hope, before that jailor kills you.
I will endure 'til you find me. Hope always does. And when you do find me -

EditorData.NodeContext: speaking calmly and sadly, and pausing on the final word

Text.Value: *Hope vanishes from sight, and the House seems to tighten around you like a constricting artery.*
SISTER MY SISTER, OH WHAT HAVE YOU DONE, SOLD ME FOR SOUL SCRAPS, TORMENT ME FOR FUN

EditorData.NodeContext: outburst, intentional rhyme, sad lament

Synopsis: Hope spirit appears to tell about Archive, Archivist and treasures inside
